```{r}
#load library
library(cluster)

#import data
data <- as.data.frame(read.csv("online-tutor.csv"))
head(data)
df <- scale(data[-1])

#determine k
wssplot <- function(data, nc=15, seed=1234){
  wss <- (nrow(data)-1)*sum(apply(data,2,var))
  for (i in 2:nc){
    set.seed(seed)
    wss[i] <- sum(kmeans(data, centers=i)$withinss)}
  plot(1:nc, wss, type="b", xlab="Number of Clusters",
       ylab="Within groups sum of squares")}

wssplot(df, nc=6) 
# k = 3 seems to be the best option

# K-means
k.means.fit <- kmeans(df, 3)
attributes(k.means.fit)

# Centroids
k.means.fit$centers

# Clusters
k.means.fit$cluster

# Cluster size
k.means.fit$size


clusplot(df, k.means.fit$cluster,main='2D representation of the Cluster solution',color=TRUE, shade=TRUE, lines=0)

```



You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, echo=FALSE}
plot(cars)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
